articles.description: Vice President Mike Pence paused, shook his head and smiled when he was asked how, as a “sensible Midwesterner,” he put up with all the “chaos and periodic silliness” in Washington. He took a question from the audience at the 2017 WSJ CEO Council. Photo: Denn…

articles.title: Vice President Pence on Taxes and Trade
articles.description: Mike Pence says the administration thinks they have the votes for tax reform—and offers a defense of the president’s leadership qualities.

articles.author: Mike Colias
articles.title: Auto Executives Meet With Pence on Nafta
articles.description: Top executives from Detroit’s auto makers met with Vice President Mike Pence in Washington Monday, reiterating concerns that potential changes to Nafta could disrupt the industry’s intricate supply chains.

articles.author: Peter Nicholas
articles.title: Pence Presses CEOs to Help Sell Tax Overhaul
articles.description: Vice President Mike Pence said he believes that Republicans will secure the votes to pass a tax overhaul that is now making its way through Congress, whatever the outcome of the volatile senate race in Alabama.

articles.author: Peter Nicholas
articles.title: Pence PAC Steers Funds to Dozens of GOP Candidates
articles.description: Vice President Mike Pence will dip into his new political-action committee to help Republicans keep control of Congress and statehouses, contributing more than $200,000 to candidates in dozens of races across the country, his office said.

articles.author: Farnaz Fassihi
articles.title: Pence Says U.S. Weighing Embassy Move in Israel
articles.description: Vice President Mike Pence said the White House is actively considering when and how to move the U.S. Embassy in Israel from Tel Aviv to Jerusalem, a campaign promise the Trump administration has so far put on hold.

articles.author: Jason Gay
articles.title: Of Pence and Peyton: The NFL Rage Continues
articles.description: Jason Gay: Vice President Mike Pence舗s walkout after a protest during the national anthem is latest chapter in a confrontational month.

articles.author: Andrew Beaton
articles.title: Vice President Mike Pence Leaves Colts Game After Anthem Protest
articles.description: Vice President Mike Pence attended and then left Sunday舗s Indianapolis Colts game in response to players protesting during the national anthem.

articles.author: Mike Colias
articles.title: GM, Ford, Fiat-Chrysler again raise Nafta reform concerns with Pence
articles.description: Top executives from Detroit’s auto makers met with Vice President Mike Pence in Washington Monday, reiterating concerns that potential changes to the North American Free Trade Agreement could disrupt the industry’s intricate supply chains.

articles.title: U.S. Flexes Naval Muscle Near North Korea
articles.description: In the biggest show of force by the U.S. in the region in a decade, three aircraft carriers conducted military drills just several hundred miles from the coast of North Korea. Photo: Dvids

articles.author: Andy Pasztor
articles.title: NTSB Cites Cockpit Errors in Pence Plane Incident Last Year
articles.description: Pilot violations of several basic landing safeguards caused the chartered jet carrying then-vice presidential candidate Mike Pence to roll off the end of a wet New York runway last October.

articles.author: Andy Pasztor
articles.title: The Wall Street Journal: Pence vows U.S. will return to the moon
articles.description: Laying out the most specific plans yet to promote commercial and military space projects, Vice President Mike Pence on Thursday vowed to return U.S. astronauts to the moon while studying ways to streamline federal rules controlling rocket launches.

articles.author: Peter Nicholas
articles.title: Warsh Met With Vice President Pence About Top Fed Job Last Week
articles.description: Kevin Warsh, a candidate for the Federal Reserve chairmanship, met with Vice President Mike Pence last week to talk about the central-bank job, according to a White House aide.

articles.author: Andrew Ackerman
articles.title: Congress Votes to Overturn CFPB Arbitration Rule
articles.description: With Vice President Mike Pence breaking a Senate tie, Congress overturned a rule by an Obama-appointed financial regulator that would have made it easier for consumers to sue banks in groups.

articles.author: Del Quentin Wilber and Tawnell D. Hobbs
articles.title: Video Shows Gunman Methodically Killing Church Members
articles.description: Investigators are reviewing video footage from inside the Baptist church that shows the gunman pacing the aisles shooting young and old congregants at close range.

articles.title: What to Watch for at WSJ's CEO Council
articles.description: The Wall Street Journal is hosting top Washington policy makers at its WSJ CEO Council meeting, including Sen. Mitch McConnell (R., Ky.), Vice President Mike Pence and others, who will be pressed on the GOP tax plans. WSJ's Gerald F. Seib tells us what to loo…

articles.author: Tawnell D. Hobbs
articles.title: Church in Texas Shooting Will Not Reopen
articles.description: The south Texas church where a gunman opened fire during a morning service Sunday, killing 26 people and injuring 20 others, won’t reopen, the pastor said.

articles.author: Kate Davidson
articles.title: GOP Divided Over Monetary Policy as Fed Chief Pick Looms
articles.description: After criticizing the Fed for the past eight years, Republicans finally have a chance to change the course of the central bank when President Donald Trump nominates someone to take the helm in early 2018. But they are divided over which direction monetary pol…

articles.author: Felicia Schwartz
articles.title: Tillerson Says He 'Never Considered Leaving This Post'
articles.description: Secretary of State Rex Tillerson said Wednesday he has not contemplated resigning his job and praised President Donald Trump’s foreign policy, after a report that he called Mr. Trump a ‘moron’ and nearly quit.
